org.apache.river.api.security

Interface AdvisoryDynamicPermissions

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActivateWrapper.ExportClassLoader, PreferredClassLoader, PreferredFactoryClassLoader

    @Beta
public interface AdvisoryDynamicPermissions
    Jar files that include a META-INF/PERMISSIONS.LIST file, allow a ProxyPreparer to grant these permissions dynamically.

    The PERMISSIONS.LIST file must be UTF-8 encoded, the format of the file is line based, length is not limited, however lines must be readable by BufferedReader.readLine().

    Syntax:

    Comments begin with # or //.

    A permission is represented by three whitespace delimited strings:

    • type - The fully qualified class name of the permission. The class must be a subclass of java.security.Permission and must define a 2-argument constructor that takes a name string and an actions string.
    • name - The permission name that will be passed as the first argument to the constructor of the Permission class identified by type.
    • actions - The permission actions that will be passed as the second argument to the constructor of the Permission class identified by type.

    The encoded format is: 

     (type)
    or 
     (type "name")
    or 
     (type "name" "actions")
    where name and actions are strings that must be encoded for proper parsing. Specifically, the ",\, carriage return, and line feed characters must be escaped using \", \\,\r, and \n, respectively.

    The encoded string contains no leading or trailing whitespace characters. A single space character is used between type and "name" and between "name" and "actions".

    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    peter

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Permission[] DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Permission[] getPermissions()
      Advisory permissions for smart proxy's, the client may or may not grant them.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS

        static final Permission[] DEFAULT_PERMISSIONS

    • Method Detail

      • getPermissions

        Permission[] getPermissions()
        Advisory permissions for smart proxy's, the client may or may not grant them. This method is typically called from a ProxyPreparer implementation. If the client chooses to grant these permissions, it may do so to a specific proxy with Principals belonging to a specific ClassLoader after authenticating the proxy's principal.
        Returns:
        unshared array containing only advisory permissions and no null references.
